DataElement.preferredName: Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Answer Reuse Template Observation Outcome Target Coding System ISO21090.Uid.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A reusable, "template" description of an allowable response to an eligibility criterion question. The coding system to use for recording results for the associated activity or evaluation.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Answer Reuse Template Observation Outcome Target Coding System
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.:A statement (either spoken or written) that is made in reply to a question or request or criticism or accusation; a statement that solves a problem or explains how to solve the problem.:To use again.:Something that establishes or serves as a pattern for reference; a form, mold, or pattern used as a guide to making something.:Watching something and taking note of what happens.:The result of an action._An object fixed as a goal or point of examination; something to point at; a destination.:The activity of implementing rules that are used to map the elements of one set onto the elements of another set, usually on a one-to-one basis.:A group of independent but interrelated elements comprising a unified whole.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Answer Reuse Template Observation Outcome
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.:A statement (either spoken or written) that is made in reply to a question or request or criticism or accusation; a statement that solves a problem or explains how to solve the problem.:To use again.:Something that establishes or serves as a pattern for reference; a form, mold, or pattern used as a guide to making something.:Watching something and taking note of what happens.:The result of an action.

Concepts.definition: Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.
A statement (either spoken or written) that is made in reply to a question or request or criticism or accusation; a statement that solves a problem or explains how to solve the problem.
Something that establishes or serves as a pattern for reference; a form, mold, or pattern used as a guide to making something.
Watching something and taking note of what happens.

Property.preferredDefinition: An object fixed as a goal or point of examination; something to point at; a destination.:The activity of implementing rules that are used to map the elements of one set onto the elements of another set, usually on a one-to-one basis.:A group of independent but interrelated elements comprising a unified whole.

Concepts.definition: An object fixed as a goal or point of examination; something to point at; a destination.
The activity of implementing rules that are used to map the elements of one set onto the elements of another set, usually on a one-to-one basis.
A group of independent but interrelated elements comprising a unified whole.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A string that is an identifier, and therefore must be either a string representation of an OID, a UUID, or a simple token taken from a lsit of controlled names for the context in which the Uid is used.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Health Informatics - Harmonized data types for information interchange

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Text; the words of something written.
